content.label: Could make a option to turn on and off the naming of items when dropped. One of my favorite games now on Mobile and No internet.

title.label: Can you fix don’t starve sw

content.label: Pleas fix the sound,bugs,glitches
I just purchased the game but it won’t load even using all of the standard settings.   Reloaded the app.  Went on line for patches.  A total waste of time and money

I want to point out that eating is way too slow. There should be some way to avoid having to tap middle bar every time to eat. Same goes for adding fuel any other way. Still love the game, and want to see some improvements.

title.label: I wish I could give it more stars, BUT...

content.label:
Sigh, ok, I like this game. I do. But there seems to quite a few problems with it. 

See, there’s this glitch in one of my plays where it’s just hot ALL THE TIME. And it’s not even summer! In fact, I think I customized it specifically so it wouldn’t have seasons, so I could explore the game without having to worry about the cold, the wet, and the heat. I could just explore the game and what it had to offer. I could deal with the seasons at a later time when I’m more familiar with that game, but having to deal with heat WHEN I ASKED FOR NO HEAT is really tedious.

Also, not to mention, I think some knight boats randomly spawned near my base for some reason even though I asked for fewer. It’s good to have them for gears I guess, ya know, to make a fridge and stuff, but they’re in the way of the island where I kept my Doy doys! There’s like, three of them there and I don’t know why! I’m pretty sure they weren’t there when I first discovered the island, so I’m not sure why they’re there now!

Further more, there are more glitches that need to be fixed but I don’t think I have room to put them all here. Overall, great game, but needs work.

title.label: Loving Everything OTHER THAN the BUGS!

content.label:
Firstly, let me say that this game is beautiful. The design is stunning and the scenery is also. The characters have their own styles and “voice” which is typically the music. 
Secondly, I would also say that the journey is a very fun one. It’s adventurous. I use it as a challenge to see how many days I can survive and to dig out the secrets. I want to unlock and discover everything. Maybe there’s a way to escape? Maybe not? Only as the days continue, Will I probably find out.
Lastly, the bugs. It’s terrible. I would give it five stars but I my character glitching in the game as my days get longer. The music starts to get all disoriented and that’s not just from losing my sanity. My sanity can be perfectly fine but the music isn’t. Then the colors start to fade, which is annoying because everything goes to a gray color. The birds don’t even sound like birds anymore. Even when I close out the game and open it again, it fixes it for a while and then it goes back to crap again. Please fix. 
Other than this, I would recommend to anyone looking for a challenge within a stunning game.
Great game and I love the art style, the new characters are all awesome and very fun to play as, I find it a little harder to advance then the original but that’s just me.

title.label: Addicting, Amazing, and utterly frustrating from dying all the time

content.label: This game is very, very fun. I lay it on my iPad and I don’t see anything wrong with it. You don’t even need wifi! The graphics are smooth and the animations are cool, so I would really suggest this game or maybe any don’t starve.
Are you working on his game for a long time and it has been worth it it is hard to get stuff but it is worth it I have a great time playing and told other people that they should play they loved it.

Overall really challenging, so much that I had to play a few times with settings to “no night” and it’s still a challenge to find resources.  Would be great if there were command cheats like Minecraft.

The story is there, it’s in every detail of the beginning of the game, such is their MO. This game is not really fully intended for the phone, but for the computer. It’s also on the PlayStation list and I’m sure even XBox might have one too. If you want to play games based on other people’s opinions, then you might not play ANY GAME, every game has its flaws and it’s perks. It’s up to you to decide, based on the gameplay itself, do you like the game. It’s not about my opinion or theirs, it’s about YOUR opinion. This game is a work of art, you don’t have to appreciate it, others will. You don’t have to understand it, because trust me, OTHERS WILL. (All upper cased words are done so to emphasize not seem like I’m yelling ) I say one thing they should add for this game, is a setting to connect a controller and to apply a configuration for how to access and use and fight and move.

Don't get me wrong, I love the Dont starve series, but i feel like i just got cheated out of my money. Because as soon as i bought it one game took forever to load. All i gotta say is, UPDATE DON’T STARVE SHIP-WRECKED!!! Please! Im not getting my moneys worth!!!
Can you add controller support for iOS just like don't starve please i would greatly appreciate it

I love the game seriously the items the recipes but one thing the game takes forever and I’m not kidding it takes so long to load and all the things in the game that attack you are overpowered like those living trees the pig people or whatever and those big crocodiles. even snakes kill the best of players. At least add something in the game that you can make friends with. I still like the game how it is but needs a bit of an upgrade. I hope this was helpful to everyone bye.

I hope you will consider this, and fix it, cause it’s hoe salty really annoying.
This is a great game but trying to find the volcano or slot machine is challenging what you could add is on one of the treasure maps it sends you to the volcano or slot machine

I loved the first don’t starve game and it’s graphics were so clean. This version on the other hand is rough around the edges when it comes to graphics. I play this on my iPad Pro and I expect crisp image quality but all I get is glitchy and over saturated colors. Please update the graphics, they make the game less enjoyable.

I absolutely love all things Don’t Starve. Don’t Starve and Shipwrecked are the ONLY games that I own on three different platforms (PC, iPhone, and XBox1) because I love being able to play the different versions and have it in my pocket for free time or marathons at home on PC or Xbox. 

But when I’m playing on mobile, it’s incredibly easy for real life to distract me and for my character to die. That stinks. I play strictly “No Sweat” on Don’t Starve and was expecting a similar version on Shipwrecked when I recently purchased it. 

An update including a “No Sweat” option would be incredibly appreciated! 

Thank you Klei Entertainment for an amazing series of games that have kept me entertained, frustrated, and surprised for YEARS!! 

(PS, I’m totally going to reference your games in a homebrew DND campaign that I’m writing for my close friends and current party members!)

title.label: I don’t know what to do

title.label: Almost as good as in PC

content.label: If you liked Don’t Starve on the PC, you’ll most likely enjoy this game. My only critique is that I wish there was a way to work with a stack of multiple items (ie- cook stack, and build many vs build one). This would make gameplay seem a little more smooth as you wouldn’t have to keep opening and closing the menus to build multiple items or cook multiple things.

Bug map

this isn’t a watered down version. This is, to the best of my knowledge, the full blown game. Great game, countless hours of game play. Cute gfx. Good price

content.label: I love the game and it’s properties! But I wish they would make a don’t starve together version on shipwrecked (if you haven’t already, I’m not sure) but for IOS devices like phones and iPads! Me and my cousin are really into this game and I wish that we could play together in the shipwrecked version of don’t starve. But overall it’s a awesome game and I love the work people put into it and the creativity!

I absolutely love this game. I originally got it on my PS4 and it played it on my Vita as well. When I saw it available on IOS I immediately purchased it. I’ve been playing it occasionally on and off for 4 years and still don’t tire of it. I love the graphics and the easy of casual playing it.
My only issue with the mobile version is that there is a little bit of issues with the iPhone X, everything still works it’s just there is a little bit of the screen getting cut off by the notch

title.label: No MFI Controller Support. But the original does...

content.label:
The controls are horrible so I want to use a controller instead. The original Don’t Starve for iOS lets me, but this newer and more expensive version doesn’t!

So unacceptable.
This game is very fun and I love it but. Why is Chester replaced? Why not have a Chester but with a tail so it can swim? And yes I am giving the game 5 stars.

Ok so first, I love the Don’t Starve series, I have both Don’t Starve and Don’t Starve Together on PS4 and I have to say, that experience is miles ahead of this port for the following reasons:

1. When using the virtual joystick to control your character, if you try to use both the joystick and your action buttons, the joystick will freeze in the current direction you have it as long as the action button is held. Can this be fixed? It’s a huge annoyance when trying to harvest materials and the character walks right by them and gets killed. 

2. When utilizing a chest, it is absolutely impossible to see what is inside it. I’ve noticed that when you select your current inventory, it zooms in so you can see the contents, why can’t chests and Packim Baggins do the same thing? That’s a huge annoyance as well for someone like me who loves coordination.

3. Instead of having to use two fingers on the top or bottom to switch viewing angles, why not have arrows on the upper corners of the screen like the bumper inputs on a PS4 controller? Having to use two fingers is wonky as hell since half the time you’re zooming in and losing all focus anyhow. 

These are all easily repairable if you guys read these reviews, please do so!
I’ve had it 4 less than 10 hours it is epic
Love it great game!  5-star worthy!!!   😀
I love this game, but I wish you would put out an update to have it match the computer version more and fix the bugs.
Add the easy mode option like in the original otherwise not worth it

I love this game, and can get lost playing it, but I cannot play my own music when playing this, or even listen to the noises of the game when I use Bluetooth headphones. If this was fixed, I’d be so much happier with the game.
But can you add Don’t starve together to the App Store because it’s a bit easy

This is my favored game on my I Pad and I love playing it! But I do have a few suggestions. I think you should add no sweat to it and also add a default plus. I think you could also make it easier to find volcanos. You could also make the world not take so long to load. Thank you and I hope you take this into consideration.

title.label: Great game, difficult to control. No Wigfrid.

content.label:
In short, if you like the original Don’t Starve game, you’ll like this one too. 
The only thing that keeps this game from getting 5 stars is that the controls are a bit finicky... it’s fine when you’re just walking around the world, gathering and building things, but it’s a nightmare when you’re fighting an enemy, especially when there’s a lot of trees in the way. Your character will just stand still, making some comment about the tree you just clicked on, while some monster chomps away at him! It’s especially bad since a lot of the fighting requires you to hit the enemy a couple times before running a small distance away to dodge their attack. You need to make sure you’re in a wide open space to fight anything effectively.
Also, you can’t play as Wigfrid (my favorite character), so you can’t just tank the enemy attacks.

This is my favorite game out of all my games! The art it outstanding! I love the Don’t Starve series! I think it’s really funny how you can find that ball in the sea that talks! I think it’s a reference to Wilson the volleyball!

The Don’t Starve games are unique - playing with different characters or different difficulties completely changes what your personal ‘purpose’ of the game might be. Some characters are better than others for different reasons. Lately, I like to make it so I am less likely to die, then see how far underground I can go.
Love this, but please do a sandbox mode like the original pocket version has. 👌🏼
